alert.note: Alert for Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 9:53AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Camden, southeastern Pasquotank and southeastern Currituck Counties through 1030 AM EST... At 952 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Shiloh to Columbia. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Shiloh and Old Trap around 1000 AM EST. Corolla around 1010 AM EST. Point Harbor around 1020 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Poplar Branch, Spot, Aydlett, Listers Corner, Glen Cove, Harbinger, Jarvisburg, Coinjock and Frog Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EST for northeastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
